Issues.Title: Angular httpclient sends a request with a special character problem
Issues.Body: I use angular6. When I use HttpClient to send a request, the parameter has a "+" character. Usually, the "+" is automatically converted to "%2B" in the browser, and the HttpClient of the angular is not "+". Escaped, causing the server to receive is a "space", how should it be solved?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular httpclient sends a request with a special character problem" (#31359)

Issues.Title: Injection by the equivalent (but not same instance) of the InjectionToken does not work
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/core` ### Is this a regression? Not sure ### Description When provider defines binding for `InjectionToken` (rather than for Type), the injection can be made only with the same instance of `InjectionToken`. It's expected to work with the equivalent InjectionToken as well. ```typescript const token1 = new InjectionToken('MyInjectionToken'); const token2 = new InjectionToken('MyInjectionToken'); const injector = Injector.create({providers: [ { provide: token1, useValue: 'My value' } ]}) // Expected: injection should succeed, // Actual: exception is thrown const injectedValue = injector.get(token2); ``` ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction [reproduction at stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-snbyse) ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error 

preview-4adb70f742b91f09679fb.js:1 ERROR Error: StaticInjectorError[InjectionToken MyInjectionToken]: 
  NullInjectorError: No provider for InjectionToken MyInjectionToken!
    at NullInjector.get (injector.ts:39)
    at resolveToken (injector.ts:334)
    at tryResolveToken (injector.ts:276)
    at StaticInjector.get (injector.ts:156)
    at AppComponent.ngOnInit (VM2377 app.component.ts:21)
    at checkAndUpdateDirectiveInline (provider.ts:205)
    at checkAndUpdateNodeInline (view.ts:429)
    at checkAndUpdateNode (view.ts:389)
    at debugCheckAndUpdateNode (services.ts:429)
    at debugCheckDirectivesFn (services.ts:390)
## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
6.1.1
Reproduced also with Angular 8 **Anything else relevant?**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Injection by the equivalent (but not same instance) of the InjectionToken does not work" (#31357)

Issues.Title: test(zone.js): fix typo Pendng -> Pending
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
The error message has `--Pendng`:
```
Error: Timeout - Async callback was not invoked within timeout specified by jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL.
--Pendng async tasks are: [type: macroTask, source: requestAnimationFrame, args: {isPeriodic:false,delay:undefined,args:[object Arguments],handleId:15}]
```

Issue Number: Relates to #31144


## What is the new behavior?
The error message is `--Pending`:
```
Error: Timeout - Async callback was not invoked within timeout specified by jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL.
--Pending async tasks are: [type: macroTask, source: requestAnimationFrame, args: {isPeriodic:false,delay:undefined,args:[object Arguments],handleId:15}]
```

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

## Other information

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
The current naming may be confusing to some users: `[attr.fill]="fill"`.

Issue Number: Relates to #30559


## What is the new behavior?
The naming is less potentially confusing: `[attr.fill]="fillColor"`

- add e2e test for SVG template example
- add SVG template component to example app
- fix template syntax example app
  - linting errors
  - runtime exceptions
  - template type errors
  - deprecated type casting
  - deprecated currency pipe example

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

PR suggested by @gkalpak in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/30559#discussion_r298796259.

Issues.Title: Tree shakable component providers
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ feature request

### Relevant Package

@angular/core

### Description

I can tree shake components/directives, and module providers.

I want to tree shake component/directive providers, for services that are created per-component/directive.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Perhaps `providedIn: Component`? Not really sure.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

No general solution that I know of.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tree shakable component providers" (#31355)

Issues.Title: Angular 8 Ivy - Components created via eRenderComponent do not invoke lifecycle events??
Issues.Body:
### Affected Package Not sure what packages are affected ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I'm not sure if this is a bug or intended behavior. Creating components dynamically via **ÉµrenderComponent** does not fire the lifecycle event **ngOnInit** for that component. Is this intended behavior? ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction My reproduction is here: https://github.com/Igneous01/ivy-dynamic-module In this code there is a feature-module that contains a feature-component with an ngOnInit that logs output to console. This component is rendered dynamically inside of app.component.ts using dynamic import and erenderComponent. When running this solution we can observe that ngOnInit is not called and no output is logged. ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): __load_patch and __symbol__ should be in zone_extern for closure compiler
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: #30533 
If we use `Zone.__symbol__` in application or angular code, after closure compiler, the `__symbol__` will be gone, because this API is internal and not exist in extern declaration file `zone_extern.js`. We need to add those APIs (__symbol__ and __load_patch) because they are also public APIs.

## What is the new behavior?

`__symbol__ and __load_patch` becomes public APIs.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Navigate to:  http://localhost:4200/my-app. The user is redirected to: http://localhost:4200/#/my-route by the app component.   On page reload at http://localhost:4200/#/my-route, the page displays â€œCannot GET /â€œ.  The network tab of the dev tools shows a 404 for http://localhost:4200/. Issues.Title: I discover a bug in transfer data between two components that are not in the same level with rxjs/Subject
Issues.Body:
Hi Angular's Team Developer
I what to notice a important issue that I discorded it from angular 5. When we try to transfer(send and receive) data between to components that are not there in the same level. The Subject method is not responsible. 
For example when component A is in a module and component B is in the main root of App folder the Subject method doe not useful and can not transfer data between component A and B. 
At first you should use of subject in a service same at App folder level for sending data from component A to service and after it you should subscribe data in app.component.ts from service and use of @Input() method to send data from app.component.ts to component B.

I found it and test it.
I think angular's team did not have attention to same level of components for transferring data between two components in Subject rxjs method.

+---â€” app
|   +--â€” Module
|   |   |--component A
|   |   |-->level component A
|   |
|   |  component B 
|   |
|   |--app.component.ts
|   |--app.module.ts 
|   |-->level component B

Sincerely yours
Hassan Khaleghi Rad.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "I discover a bug in transfer data between two components that are not in the same level with rxjs/Subject  " (#31343)

Issues.Title: Dependency injection and class inheritance doesn't work in Angular 8 library test
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/core@^8

### Is this a regression?
Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular/core@7


### Description

The problem occurs when:

1. The base class has a constructor with an injected service. (`Injector` from the example)

```ts
@Injectable()
export class BaseService {
  // "Injector" is just for the sake of example. Any injectable would have the same problem.
  constructor(public injector: Injector) {
  }
}
```
2. Child class has no constructor (i.e., it relies on base class constructor) AND at least one property with the default value.

```ts
@Injectable()
export class MyLibService extends BaseService {

  public foo = 'bar';

}
```

3. (_dont ask me how I have found this, but:_) In `angular.json` `[lib name].test.options.codeCoverage` should be true. 

### PROBLEM:   

`injector` is undefined in the instance of `MyLibService`. 

--- 

ğŸš© Removing property from the child class _(2)_ AND/OR opting out `codeCoverage` config in angular.json _(3)_ doesn't brake test.

As a result, I can't have a class inheritance and code coverage at the same time.

---

I could put a constructor in the child class and call `super` by passing all required arguments manually, but it's the last option since the real-life scenario is much more complicated than the example provided here.

## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction
git repo: https://github.com/ddramone/ng-8-library-inheritance-di-test-bug

reproduce steps:

1. Install angular 8 cli
2. Clone `git clone https://github.com/ddramone/ng-8-library-inheritance-di-test-bug.git `
3. `npm i`
4. run Test `ng test my-lib`

 ### Expected behavior

Test should pass = Injector service should be available in the service instance.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dependency injection and class inheritance doesn't work in Angular 8 library test" (#31337)

Issues.Title: fix(core): handle `undefined` meta in `injectArgs`
Issues.Body:
In the recent versions of the CLI we introduced a ctor downlevel for VE JIT build based on the one found in tsickle, to fix the TDZ issue of `forwardRef`.

However this caused a regression as the injector is not handling that a position paramType can be undefined. Which is bubbled down to https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/c6b29f4c6d23b1510db3434cb030203d5bdea119/packages/core/src/di/injector_compatibility.ts#L162 and will crash https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/c6b29f4c6d23b1510db3434cb030203d5bdea119/packages/core/src/di/injector_compatibility.ts#L174-L186

Fixes https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/14888

In the guide about angular/elements there is an example, the issue is related to the code available for download in the end of the session https://angular.io/guide/elements#example-a-popup-service.

1) Download the code from the the link int the page, pointing to https://angular.io/generated/zips/elements/elements.zip.

the package

Issues.Title: Custom compiler(transpiler) options for ngtools/webpack
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ Feature request
Additional compiler(transpiler) options for ngtools/webpack

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
Setting different compiler is needed sometimes, especially if we would like to use custom TypeScript transformers. In this particular case the best option is "ttypescript" but there could be other as well. It should only support compilers that have same interface as "typescript".

### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be great if we could set which compiler will be used, as in https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-loader ```compiler``` option. The perfect location for choosing the compiler in MY opinion would be tsconfig 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I've tried to use custom loaders and override tsx files compilation, but the issue in this case is that everything that's done in ngtools/webpack will be left out, like including html templates, and probably many other things related to AoT.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Custom compiler(transpiler) options for ngtools/webpack" (#14947)

Issues.Title: Fix prettier setup for repo
Issues.Body:
Currently there are unsolved problems with prettier. The big ones being

- PRs don't pass prettier check in CI if the PR is not exactly one commit on top of master(This can be fixed)
- Code reviews are messed up because unrelated lines are formatted and pollute the PR and impossible for reviewer to focus on the actual change
- Messes up history/blame pretty quickly if PR changes unrelated lines

Till we figure out an precise prettier format that formats only changed lines we should disable it.

Joey is going to be looking at common formatting solution across various Angular projects.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fix prettier setup for repo" (#14939)

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): NGCC should process secondary entry-points
Issues.Body:
Previously secondary entry-points, e.g
`@angular/common/http`,  were being resolved to
the primary entry-point, e.g `@angular/common`.
This meant that these entry-points were not being
processed as part of a compilation leading to error messages.

This change inverts the `tryResolvePackage` logic
to attempt to use `require.resolve()` first and only
looking in the parent directory of the typings file
as a fallback if the main resolve fails.

Fixes https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30972#issuecomment-506428267
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): NGCC should process secondary entry-points" (#14934)

Issues.Title: NodeModuleEngineHost tightly coupled to process working directory
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ Feature request

### Description
This is a request for a minor change.

The schematics_cli and angular_cli assume that they will be called from inside a project directory that contains the installed schematics. 

I have no issue with this, however, if I wanted to build an alternative CLI (or Electron application (which is what I intend to do)) that won't be executed from the directory that contains the schematics but instead references an alternative directory, then I need to rebuilt this entire class (or at least subclass and override the _resolveCollectionPath method).  This has highlighted that this class is tightly coupled to process.cwd and that this should instead be passed as an argument.

**More details**
 
Class NodeModulesEngineHost. Whilst methods _resolvePackageJson, _resolvePath accept a path to be provided, _resolveCollectionPath uses process.cwd() when calling them. This means that this class will always use the processes current working directory to identify schematics.

Instead, in my opinion, the class that creates the NodeModulesEngineHost should provide the baseDir. i.e. add (private path: string) to the constructor and then update the cli implementations to pass the path.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "NodeModuleEngineHost tightly coupled to process working directory" (#14935)

# ğŸ Bug report This is an incorrect result that I'm receiving when creating a custom schematic. I'm just including a code snippet for the part of the schematics libraries utilities that produce this issue. ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Description I created an Angular Workspace, then an application (demo-one, and demo-two), and a Library project for this example. The relative path produced by ```buildRelativePath``` works when working within the same project between folders, but doesn't seem to work when using workspaces, between a library and an application. Here's the default application structure built by the Angular Cli: ``` projects | |- demo-two |- src |- environments |... |- shared-libs |- src |- core |- interceptors ``` ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction const fromPath = '/projects/shared-libs/src/core/interceptors'; const toPath = '/projects/demo-two/src/environments'; const relativePath = buildRelativePath(fromPath, toPath); console.log('relative path: ', relativePath); relativePath returns "../../../demo-two/src/environments" C:\Users\king\source\repos\Schematics\HostWorkspace\projects\demo-two\src\environments C:\Users\king\source\repos\Schematics\HostWorkspace\projects\shared-libs\src\core\interceptors should be "../../../../demo-two/src/environments" ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error No error, just an incorrect relative path. ## ğŸŒ Your Environment

    Node: 8.11.3
    OS: win32 x64
    Angular: 7.1.4

Issues.Title: Invalidating lazy loaded modules
Issues.Body:
Hi!

Hopefully this is the correct repo to ask as I'm not sure if its more related to CLI or angular itself, just as I'm not sure if its intentional or possible bug/feature request, but here we go - I have following setup:

- Differential loading
- Lazy modules
- Angular source files hosted on CDN
- Angular app available on multiple domains

The problem I'm struggling with is that Angular requests all child modules with:

```javascript
https://cdn.net/app/30-es2015.js
https://cdn.net/app/31-es2015.js
```

When deploying new version I need to change the version query string (as can be seen above) as otherwise when angular requests:

```
https://cdn.net/app/30-es2015.js
```
it loads cached version because the `max-age` is set to a year and its cached in the CDN anyways so it wouldn't get latest version.

This would be ok if I could control the query string of lazy loaded modules. Is that possible?

Thank you for any suggestions or help :-)

Issues.Title: Form field Floating labels gaps not customizable and not taking into account the label actual size
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
So here is the thing. Since no dense mode and since we have a custom looking material inputs, I had to make my own customization on the scss theme of the form field. The problem appeared when I changed the font size and the font itself of the floating label. Suddenly I saw that the borders are overlapping the text.
```
const floatingLabelScale = 0.75;
const outlineGapPadding = 5;
```
these values are based on some assumption that the label size will never be customized.
Now, in order to override this behavior I had to create my own directive that changes the values 
and recalculate the gaps. 
So I would like to request a change of this logic to calculate gaps dynamically, or to expose these 2 numbers as inputs or something that can be changed from outside. I'm ok with an injection token as well.

#### Use Case

In order to allow more customization features and be able to change the font-size of the floating label.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form field Floating labels gaps not customizable and not taking into account the label actual size" (#16411)

Issues.Title: fix(portal): running change detection before nodes have been moved to outlet
Issues.Body:
Currently we run change detection as soon as we create a portal's embedded view and afterwards we transfer its DOM nodes into the portal outlet. This is problematic, because running change detection also executes any lifecycle hooks which means that directives inside the portal, which are looking at the DOM, will be invoked while the element is still at its old location.

**Note:** marking this as a P2, because it's a fairly small change and it's fixing something that's caused other timing-related issues for us in the past.

Fixes #16346.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(portal): running change detection before nodes have been moved to outlet" (#16407)

Issues.Title: .cdk-overlay-pane does not fit .cdk-overlay-container
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-overlay-scroll
2. Scroll body
3. Press 'overlay' button
 
 
#### Expected Behavior 

`.cdk-overlay-pane` fits `.cdk-overlay-container` if `BlockScrollStrategy` is used.


#### Actual Behavior

`.cdk-overlay-pane` does not fit `.cdk-overlay-container` if `BlockScrollStrategy` is used.
A part of `.cdk-overlay-pane` is out `.cdk-overlay-container`.
There is no way to scroll to the bottom of the last `.overlay-items__item`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8931568/60344410-2c25f880-99bf-11e9-8f0b-b53deda63a53.png)


#### Environment

- Angular: 7, 8
- CDK/Material: 7, 8
- Browser(s): Google Chrome, Firefox, Opera
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, macOS, Android

#### Suggest a Fix
I have found two ways to fix it.
1. Make `OverlayConfig#minHeight` required
2. Set default value of `OverlayConfig#minHeight`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".cdk-overlay-pane does not fit .cdk-overlay-container" (#16404)

Issues.Title: Hide panel of autocomplete on focus
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

What I would like to see is an option to disable the panel on focus.

#### Use Case

When a user focus on an autocomplete input I want the panel to be not opened.
After input it will open the panel.

#### What I tried

I have an FormArray within that FormArray I have multiple autocompletes.
For the phone the autocompletes are wrapped in an expansion panel.
When either the page open with default expansion panel or when a epansion panel get clicked it will selected the first input, in this case an autocomplete.
The autocomplete open with the panel open.
I can close it with `this.autoCompletes['_results'][0].closePanel();` which is a queryList of MatAutocompleteTrigger.
This will close the panel when I open the page.
But it doesn't if I open an expansion panel.
So I tried to add this on the focus event.
It seems that the panel will open after the focus event.
So the panel get closed before the panel get opened.

Also tried a timeout but this will first visible show the panel and then close it.

#### Solution

Either make the panel open earlier.
Make an input to disable the panel on focus.

#### Stackblitz
https://angular-sng8gx.stackblitz.io
Query list is not working for some reason..
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hide panel of autocomplete on focus" (#16401)

Issues.Title: change mat-sidenav content dynamically from any component
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

I am trying to load different components in mat-sidenav from different routed components based on some action like button click?

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I have created a singleton service 'SidenavService' to get reference to mat-sidenav using @ViewChild,  this way I can control (like open, close, toggle etc.) sidenav from anywhere in the app.

I have also created a ng-container in mat-sidenav and stored its ViewConteinerRef in SidenavService, now in any component in component hierarchy, I can inject the SidenavService and I can use ViewConteinerRef  to created embedded view.

#### What are you seeing that does not match your expectations? 

Is there a better way to achieve this? loading different components in mat-sidenav from anywhere in the app.

1. demoed in stackblitz

Issues.Title: Chip autocomplete doesn't support showing error colour and message
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-n6tpca?file=app/chips-autocomplete-example.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. select a fruit, and then remove it. The boolean display TRUE (invalid) all the time because we set the input formControl to null. The input is invalid, but the invalid class is not projected to the mat-form-field. 


 
 
#### Expected Behavior

When removing all chips, I expect to see a red border and red label, and the mat-error tag should display.


#### Actual Behavior

No error behaviour is displayed.
It could be that this is happening since the input tag is nested in the `mat-chip-list`, and can't find the parent element to apply the styles to.

Manually adding `ng-invalid && mat-form-field-invalid` via the ngClass directive does work.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8,0.2
- CDK/Material:8.01
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): MacOS Mojave
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Chip autocomplete doesn't support showing error colour and message" (#16393)

Issues.Title: Performance degradation when using an animated progress bar with multiple monitors
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Setup two monitors: 144hz, 60hz.
2. Open the progress bar example with the buffer mode: https://components-issue-4bf67t.stackblitz.io
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

Using animations should not significantly affect system performance.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

There is a performance impact on the main monitor with massive stutters. It forces the main display at 60hz.

It was not reproduced by me because I don't have multiple monitors but was reported by users multiple times with the same monitor configurations.

The problem was fixed by switching the animation mode from 'buffer' to 'determinate'. It was confirmed by users.

I'm creating this issue to find more affected people.

Feedbacks from affected users:
```
there's an issue with 144hz/60hz dual monitors setups with the website. The fact that there's that pretty animation scrolling on the bottom forces the display to update at 60hz, which, through the power of the magnificent DWM that can't handle this in 2019, forces the main display at 60hz and with massive stutters. Switching to a different tab in the browser fixes this.
```
```
this is gonna sound weird, but when i had the tab with the site open just now on my secondary monitor and waiting for a trade to pop, it really killed the performance of my game client. like it was forcing a vsync ingame or something, very noticeably choppy. it could be just a one off thing i dont know, just bringing it up in case anyone else gets that and can confirm/deny. my primary monitor is 144hz, secondary is 60hz.
i could just need a pc restart. my pc acts weird sometimes when i wake it from sleep and just go about doing my normal stuff
```

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0.0
- CDK/Material: 8.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Performance degradation when using an animated progress bar with multiple monitors" (#16389)
